description:
The measures, proposed by Koovo Minister of Health Arben Vitia, were approved at a meeting of the government held on Wednesday evening.

In full, the following measures were announced by the Kosovo Government: 

1. To close all schools, public and private, at primary, secondary and university level until March 27
type: Closure and Regulation of Schools
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description:
Following a meeting of the Kosovo Government on Friday evening, a number of additional measures to contain the spread of coronavirus were approved (taking effect immediately, 13 March 2020) after two people tested positive for the virus during the day.

The decisions taken by the Kosovo Government:

3. An immediate suspension of public transport, as well as organised international transport
type: External Border Restrictions

description:
Following a meeting of the Kosovo Government on Friday evening, a number of additional measures to contain the spread of coronavirus were approved (taking effect immediately, 13 March 2020) after two people tested positive for the virus during the day.

The decisions taken by the Kosovo Government:

4. The borders of Kosovo are closed to all foreign citizens.
type: External Border Restrictions

description:
Following a meeting of the Kosovo Government on Friday evening, a number of additional measures to contain the spread of coronavirus were approved (taking effect immediately, 13 March 2020) after two people tested positive for the virus during the day.

The decisions taken by the Kosovo Government:

5. From March 16 at 00:00, all airline services are suspended with the exception of military and aid services.
type: External Border Restrictions

description:

type: Health Resources

description:
Following a meeting of the Kosovo Government on Friday evening, a number of additional measures to contain the spread of coronavirus were approved (taking effect immediately, 13 March 2020) after two people tested positive for the virus during the day.

The decisions taken by the Kosovo Government:

4. Returning Kosovars will be subject to detailed medical checks
type: Health Testing

description:
Following a meeting of the Kosovo Government on Friday evening, a number of additional measures to contain the spread of coronavirus were approved (taking effect immediately, 13 March 2020) after two people tested positive for the virus during the day.

The decisions taken by the Kosovo Government:

1. A ban on entry and exit from the town of Klina

2. A ban on entry and exit from the town of Viti
type: Internal Border Restrictions
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: BIRN was informed by the Director of Health at the Municipality of Viti, Basri Aliu, that 17 members of staff from the Family Medicine Centre in the town have gone into isolation, while the entire village of Stubell is reported to have been put into quarantine.
type: Lockdown
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)

type: Other Policy Not Listed Above
type_text: Transportation was listed as an example of an essential government service; in this instance, Kosovo has suspended all public transport, meaning it is the restriction of an essential government service

description:
Following a meeting of the Kosovo Government on Friday evening, a number of additional measures to contain the spread of coronavirus were approved (taking effect immediately, 13 March 2020) after two people tested positive for the virus during the day.

The decisions taken by the Kosovo Government:

4. The borders of Kosovo are closed to all foreign citizens. Returning Kosovars will be subject to detailed medical checks with the instruction to self-quarantine for the next 15 days following entry.
type: Quarantine

description:
Following a meeting of the Kosovo Government on Friday evening, a number of additional measures to contain the spread of coronavirus were approved (taking effect immediately, 13 March 2020) after two people tested positive for the virus during the day.

7. The closure of livestock and automobile markets
